description: Used to express purpose or reason; 'for', 'for the sake of', 'in order to'.
explanation:
### Name
- 〜ために（目的・理由）

### Meaning and function
- Expresses two core uses:
  - Purpose/benefit: in order to; for the sake/benefit of
  - Reason/cause: because; due to; as a result of

### Form and templates
- Purpose/benefit
  - V(dict) + ために
    - Purpose the speaker/subject intends to achieve
  - N + のために
    - For the sake/benefit of N (person/group/goal)
  - Main clause typically shows an intentional action, plan, request, permission, or preparation by the same subject as in the ため-clause

- Reason/cause
  - V(plain, often past for realized causes) + ため(に)
  - い-adj + ため(に)
  - な-adj + な + ため(に)
  - N + のため(に)
  - States an objective cause; the result clause can be non-volitional or a factual outcome. “に” after ため is optional here; without “に” is slightly more formal/written

- Attributive/topic variants
  - V(dict) + ための + N; N + のための + N
    - N for the purpose of …
  - V(dict)/N + の + ためには …
    - As for/in order to … (topic), often followed by advice/requirements

- Particle and ordering notes
  - の links a noun to ため; な links a な-adjective to ため
  - ため behaves as a noun: ために, ための, ためは/ためには are all possible
  - For purpose, keep “に” (ために). For cause, “に” may be omitted (ため) in more formal writing

- Conjugation/inflection
  - Verbs before ため(に) are plain form; past form is common in the cause use for completed causes
  - い-adjectives stay in their dictionary form before ため
  - な-adjectives take な before ため

### Usage notes and constraints
- Distinguishing purpose vs reason
  - Purpose: main clause is volitional/controllable and shares the same subject as the ため-clause; often “benefit” nuance with N + のために
  - Reason: no subject restriction; often non-volitional result; more objective/formal than から/ので
- Volitional vs potential/state
  - For purpose, avoid potential forms or uncontrollable/stative predicates before ために; use 〜ように for “so that can/so that it will …”
- Register and naturalness
  - ために (purpose) is neutral and common
  - ため(に) (reason) sounds more formal/objective than から/ので and is frequent in writing, news, and announcements
  - Dropping “に” (ため) increases formality and is most natural in the reason/cause use
- Ambiguity
  - N + のために can mean “for the sake of N” (benefit) or “because of N” (cause); context resolves it. Animate N often reads as benefit; inanimate/event N often reads as cause
- Orthography
  - Usually written in hiragana: ため(に). The kanji 為 is rare in modern writing outside set phrases and formal documents

### Common mistakes (optional, only if relevant)
- Using ために (purpose) with potential or uncontrollable predicates; prefer 〜ように
- Mixing subjects in the purpose use; purpose normally requires the same subject across clauses
- Omitting “に” in the purpose use (V + ため); this sounds awkward—keep ために
- Overusing ため(に) for casual reasons in conversation where から/ので are more natural
- Using ため(に) (reason) with requests/commands; in such contexts から/ので are more natural

### Related grammar (optional, only if relevant)
- 〜ように: “so that,” used with potentials/non-volitional outcomes; contrasts with ために which prefers volitional purpose
- 〜から／〜ので: Casual/formal “because”; more conversational and flexible with requests/suggestions than ため(に)
- 〜おかげで／〜せいで: Positive vs negative cause; ため(に) is neutral/objective
- 〜にとって: “for; to” in the sense of viewpoint/assessment, not purpose/benefit
- 〜に (purpose with motion verbs): Simple “to/for (the purpose of)” tied to movement; narrower than ために

examples.jp: 合格するために、毎日早起きして勉強している。
examples.en: In order to pass, I get up early and study every day.

examples.jp: 免許を取るために、自動車学校に通いました。
examples.en: I attended a driving school to get my license.

examples.jp: 子どものために、料理を薄味にした。
examples.en: For the sake of my child, I made the dishes mildly seasoned.

examples.jp: 撮影するために、ここを少し暗くしてもいいですか。
examples.en: May we dim this area a bit for filming?

examples.jp: 寝坊しないために、アラームを三つセットした。
examples.en: I set three alarms so I wouldn't oversleep.

examples.jp: 何のためにそんなに走っているの？
examples.en: What are you running so much for?

examples.jp: 災害に備えるための水と食料を準備した。
examples.en: I prepared water and food for disaster preparedness.

examples.jp: 初心者のための解説動画を作成しました。
examples.en: I made a tutorial video for beginners.

examples.jp: 健康を維持するためには、適度な運動が欠かせない。
examples.en: To maintain your health, moderate exercise is essential.

examples.jp: 環境のためには、できるだけ電気を節約したい。
examples.en: For the environment, I want to save as much electricity as possible.

examples.jp: 健康のために、夜更かしはしないほうがいいです。
examples.en: For your health, it's better not to stay up late.

examples.jp: チームのために、今日は残業します。
examples.en: For the team, I'll work overtime today.

examples.jp: 電車が遅れたため、会議に間に合わなかった。
examples.en: Because the train was delayed, I didn’t make it to the meeting.

examples.jp: 寒いため、外に人がほとんどいなかった。
examples.en: Because it was cold, there were hardly any people outside.

examples.jp: 静かなため、赤ちゃんはすぐに眠りました。
examples.en: Since it was quiet, the baby fell asleep quickly.

examples.jp: 台風のため、イベントは中止になりました。
examples.en: Due to the typhoon, the event was canceled.

examples.jp: 渋滞のために、到着が遅れます。
examples.en: Because of traffic, arrival will be delayed.

examples.jp: 機器故障のため、現在サービスを停止しております。
examples.en: Due to equipment failure, the service is currently suspended.

examples.jp: 予算不足のため、新規採用は行われなかった。
examples.en: Owing to a lack of budget, no new hires were made.

examples.jp: 停電のために、エレベーターは止まっているのですか。
examples.en: Are the elevators stopped because of the power outage?

negativeExamples.jp: 忘れないように、メモを取った。
negativeExamples.en: I took notes so I wouldn’t forget.

negativeExamples.jp: 雨だったから、試合は中止になった。
negativeExamples.en: Because it rained, the game was canceled.

negativeExamples.jp: ため息をついたが、すぐ気持ちを切り替えた。
negativeExamples.en: I sighed, but quickly switched my mindset.

negativeExamples.jp: ため池は町の北側にあります。
negativeExamples.en: The reservoir is on the north side of town.

negativeExamples.jp: 「ために」という表現は、やや硬いと感じます。
negativeExamples.en: I feel the expression “tame ni” is somewhat stiff.

negativeExamples.jp: 子どもにとって、この映画は少し怖い。
negativeExamples.en: This movie is a bit scary for children.

negativeExamples.jp: 地震によって、多くの建物が壊れた。
negativeExamples.en: Many buildings were destroyed due to the earthquake.

negativeExamples.jp: 渋滞のせいで、遅刻した。
negativeExamples.en: I was late because of a traffic jam.

negativeExamples.jp: 毎月お金をためている。
先生は「雨のため中止」とだけ黒板に書いた。
negativeExamples.en: The teacher only wrote “Canceled due to rain” on the blackboard.
